intro: Lucilia ferruginea, commonly known as the rust-colored blowfly, is a species of fly found in various parts of the world. It belongs to the family Calliphoridae and is known for its metallic, rust-colored body. The plant aspect of this species is not directly relevant, as it is an insect, not a plant. However, it is often associated with decaying organic matter, which can be found in plant-rich environments. Its presence can indicate the decomposition stage of plant material in an ecosystem.
